turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Thoracocharax securis.
turn.1: What's the scientific name of Thoracocharax securis?
turn.2: Thoracocharax securis Thoracocharax securis, the giant hatchetfish, is a hatchetfish found in the Amazon River Basin.
turn.4: Adults will grow up to 6.8 cm in the wild and 9 cm in the aquarium.
turn.6: It is a rarely seen species in the aquarium hobby.
turn.8: It is known to glide up to 2.74 meters (9 ft) out of the water.
turn.9: Is Thoracocharax securis a good community fish?
turn.10: Thoracocharax securis should be kept in group of at least 5 individuals.
turn.11: What's the minimum tank size that Thoracocharax securis can live in?
turn.12: The minimum aquarium volume for such a group is 150 L. http://eol.org/pages/217344/overview http://www.fishbase.org/summary/Thoracocharax-securis.html
